meanings.definition: The section of a river immediately downstream from a dam.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen gathered at the tailwaters to catch fish.
meanings.sent2: The tailwaters are known for their calm and clear waters.
meanings.sent3: Why did the fish throw a party at the tailwaters? Because it was a dam good time!
meanings.sent4: The tailwaters flowed gently like a soothing lullaby.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the tailwaters mesmerized all who gazed upon them.

meanings.definition: The water released from a dam into a river.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the tailwaters surged downstream with force.
meanings.sent2: The tailwaters carried nutrients downstream, enriching the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: Why did the river refuse to play with the tailwaters? It was too dam serious!
meanings.sent4: The tailwaters rushed like a wild horse freed from its pen.
meanings.sent5: The power of the tailwaters reshaped the riverbanks over time.
